sen.j: 諸白（もろはく） とは、日本酒の醸造において、麹米と掛け米（蒸米）の両方に精白米を用いる製法の名。
sen.e: "Moro-haku" ("moro" means both sides, and "haku" means polishing) was the name of the sake brewing method using the polished rice for both "koji-mai" (the rice in which the mold of "koji" [Aspergillus oryzae] was cultivated) & "kake-mai" (also called "fukashi," meaning the steamed rice).
